changeSet.author: paulsc

preConditions.sqlCheck: select count(*) from clinlims.observation_history_type where type_name = 'nationality';

changeSet.comment: Observation history categories do not coorespond to dictionary categories for two reasons. Two survey questions might record a DH value as the same type, but the set of choices for each survey might be different. Two survey questions might use the same answers for different questions. The obvious examples there are two questions both of which use yes as choices which is 1 Dictionary type used as values for multiple demographic history entries. Each demo history entry would be marked with a different type indicating the question answered.

changeSet.author: pauls
changeSet.comment: Setting Status for RetroCI

column.name: description
column.value: No tests have been run for this sample

column.name: description
column.value: Some tests have been run on this sample

column.name: description
column.value: All tests have been run on this sample

column.name: description
column.value: This test has not yet been done

column.name: description
column.value: Test was requested but then canceled

column.name: description
column.value: The test was accepted as being valid

column.name: description
column.value: The results of the test were not accepted by the technicain

column.name: description
column.value: The Biologist did not accept this result as valid

column.name: description
column.value: The test has passed all validation and has been accepted as valid

column.name: description
column.value: The data entry has not yet started

column.name: description
column.value: The initial entry has been done

column.name: description
column.value: The second, validation, entry has been done

column.name: description
column.value: There is reason to suspect that the form was not filled out correctly

changeSet.comment: Bug Fix: Make sure any old ARV-F samples entered on a ARV-F form point to the ARV-F project.

update.where: id IN ( SELECT DISTINCT sp.id from sample_projects sp, observation_history oh WHERE proj_id IN ( select id from project where name = 'Antiretroviral Study' ) AND oh.sample_id = sp.samp_id AND oh.observation_history_type_id = ( select id from observation_history_type oht where oht.type_name = 'projectFormName' ) AND oh.value = 'FollowUpARV_Id' )

preConditions.sqlCheck: select ( (select count(0) from clinlims.test_section where display_key IS NULL ) > 0)

changeSet.comment: Make sure all test sections have language resource names.
changeSet.sql: update clinlims.test_section set display_key = 'testSection.' || name

changeSet.author: pahill
changeSet.comment: Makes sure the UNKNOWN patient is really empty.
changeSet.sql: UPDATE clinlims.patient SET external_id = NULL, national_id = NULL, birth_date = NULL, gender = NULL, lastupdated = now() FROM clinlims.person AS per WHERE per.last_name = 'UNKNOWN_' AND clinlims.patient.person_id = per.id;

column.name: analyzer_id
column.valueNumeric: ( select id from clinlims.analyzer where name = 'Evolis')

changeSet.author: paulsc
changeSet.comment: Adds missing rows to sample_project based on the observation history
changeSet.sql: insert into clinlims.sample_projects (id, samp_id, proj_id, lastupdated ) select distinct on (s.id) nextval('sample_proj_seq'), s.id, CASE WHEN oh.value = 'InitialARV_Id' then (select id from clinlims.project p where p.name = 'Antiretroviral Study') WHEN oh.value = 'FollowUpARV_Id' then (select id from clinlims.project p where p.name = 'Antiretroviral Followup Study') WHEN oh.value = 'EID_Id' then (select id from clinlims.project p where p.name = 'Early Infant Diagnosis for HIV Study') WHEN oh.value = 'RTN_Id' then (select id from clinlims.project p where p.name = 'Routine HIV Testing') WHEN oh.value = 'Indeterminate_Id' then (select id from clinlims.project p where p.name = 'Indeterminate Results') WHEN oh.value = 'Special_Request_Id' then (select id from clinlims.project p where p.name = 'Special Request') END, now() from clinlims.sample s join clinlims.observation_history oh on s.id = oh.sample_id where s.id not in ( select samp_id from clinlims.sample_projects ) and oh.observation_history_type_id = (select id from clinlims.observation_history_type where type_name = 'projectFormName');

changeSet.author: paulsc
changeSet.comment: Adds Cobas Taqman analyzer

column.name: analyzer_id
column.valueNumeric: ( select id from clinlims.analyzer where name = 'Cobas Taqman')

column.name: test_id
column.valueNumeric: (select id from clinlims.test where description = 'Viral Load' )

changeSet.author: paulsc
changeSet.comment: Adds cobas_taqman module and assigns it to the correct role

column.name: system_role_id
column.valueNumeric: ( select id from clinlims.system_role where name = 'Results Admin')

column.name: system_role_id
column.valueNumeric: ( select id from clinlims.system_role where name = 'Cobas Taqman user')

column.name: dict_entry
column.value: the paper form doesn't have any explicit answer.

changeSet.author: pahill
changeSet.comment: Adds more explicit observation history questions for all of the lists of diseases. From currentDisease value=TB or priorDisease value=pneumonia to exact questions "currTB" value = yes, no etc. to support saving various NO answers (not filled in, NA ... )

changeSet.author: pahill
changeSet.comment: Move all current diseases value = disease (dict id) to CDisease value = Yes (Yes from the proper list)
changeSet.sql: UPDATE observation_history AS oh SET observation_history_type_id = (SELECT id FROM observation_history_type AS ohts WHERE ohts.type_name = 'C' || d2.local_abbrev), value = (SELECT d1.id FROM dictionary AS d1, dictionary_category AS dc WHERE d1.local_abbrev = 'Yes' AND d1.dictionary_category_id = dc.id AND dc.local_abbrev = 'YesNo') FROM observation_history_type AS oht, dictionary AS d2, sample_projects AS sp WHERE observation_history_type_id = oht.id AND sp.proj_id IN (SELECT id FROM project WHERE program_code = 'LART') AND oh.sample_id = sp.samp_id AND oh.sample_id = sp.samp_id AND oht.type_name = 'currentDiseases' AND value_type = 'D' AND d2.id = to_number(value, '99999')

changeSet.author: pahill
changeSet.comment: Move all ARV PRIOR diseases value = disease (dict id) to "PSomeDisease" value = Yes (Yes from proper list of Yes, No)
changeSet.sql: UPDATE observation_history AS oh SET observation_history_type_id = (SELECT id FROM observation_history_type AS ohts WHERE ohts.type_name = 'P' || d2.local_abbrev), value = (SELECT d1.id FROM dictionary AS d1, dictionary_category AS dc WHERE d1.local_abbrev = 'Yes' AND d1.dictionary_category_id = dc.id AND dc.local_abbrev = 'YesNo') FROM observation_history_type AS oht, dictionary AS d2, sample_projects AS sp WHERE observation_history_type_id = oht.id AND oh.sample_id = sp.samp_id AND sp.proj_id IN (SELECT id FROM project WHERE program_code = 'LART') AND oht.type_name = 'priorDiseases' AND value_type = 'D' AND d2.id = to_number(value, '99999')

changeSet.author: pahill
changeSet.comment: Move all RTN diseases from a list of diseases to one question response (OH) for each disease with the answer "yes"
changeSet.sql: UPDATE observation_history AS oh SET observation_history_type_id = (SELECT id FROM observation_history_type AS ohts WHERE ohts.type_name = d2.local_abbrev), value = (SELECT d1.id FROM dictionary AS d1, dictionary_category AS dc WHERE d1.local_abbrev = 'Yes' AND d1.dictionary_category_id = dc.id AND dc.local_abbrev = 'YesNoNA') FROM observation_history_type AS oht, dictionary AS d2, dictionary_category as dc2 WHERE observation_history_type_id = oht.id AND dc2.local_abbrev = 'RTNDisease' AND d2.dictionary_category_id = dc2.id AND value_type = 'D' AND d2.id = to_number(oh.value, '99999')

changeSet.author: paulsc
changeSet.comment: Move under investigation comments from observation history to note table
changeSet.sql:
insert into clinlims.note (id, sys_user_id, note_type, subject, reference_table, lastupdated, reference_id, "text")
select nextval( 'note_seq' ), '1', 'I', 'UnderInvestigation', (select id from clinlims.reference_tables where name = 'observation_history'), now(), ohn.id, oh.value from clinlims.observation_history oh join clinlims.observation_history ohn on oh.sample_id = ohn.sample_id where oh.observation_history_type_id = ( select id from clinlims.observation_history_type where type_name = 'underInvestigationComment' ) and ohn.observation_history_type_id = ( select id from clinlims.observation_history_type where type_name = 'underInvestigation' );

delete.where: observation_history_type_id = ( select id from clinlims.observation_history_type where type_name = 'underInvestigationComment' )
